description: From satanic feminists, dolphin communicators, to stigmatists—take a leap of faith with Jerico Mandybur on Beyond Belief as she teases out what it means to believe. Part enlightening conversation, part edu-tainment, hear how society’s “weirdos” believe, and discover they’re not so weird in the process. After all, we all want to believe in something.

items.author: pod@wondermedianetwork.com (Wonder Media Network)
items.content: Introducing WMN's newest original podcast, Gravity, a show about what becomes possible when we look at hardships differently, hosted by Dr. Lucy Kalanithi. Join us to explore transformations around loneliness, the myth of the ideal nuclear family, climate crisis, and more. Follow and subscribe wherever you get your podcasts.

items.author: pod@wondermedianetwork.com (Wonder Media Network LLC)
items.content:
To keep up the momentum and accelerate change, we need to take action on a recurring basis, not just when it's at the top of our social media feeds or trending. So what can we do: 

If you’re in a position to donate, please consider donating to one of the following organizations:

  • The Black Lives Matter movement
  • The Black Visions Collective, a Black-led, Queer and Trans centering organization whose mission is to organize powerful, connected Black communities and dismantle systems of violence.
  • Reclaim the Block, a community coalition representing activists, organizers, faith and community leaders united by the demand that Minneapolis divest from policing and invest in long-term alternatives that would decrease the scope of MPD and promote healthier, safer, more diverse communities.
  • The ACLU, a nonprofit organization that works tirelessly in courts, legislatures, and communities to defend and preserve the Constitution’s promise of liberty for everyone in our country.
  • National Bailout, a Black-led and Black-centered collective of abolitionist organizers, lawyers and activists building a community-based movement to support our folks and end systems of pretrial detention and ultimately mass incarceration.
  • NAACP, an organization that ensures the political, educational, social, and economic equality of rights of all persons and to eliminate racial hatred and racial discrimination.
  • Sisters Inside, an Australian organization that advocates on behalf of women with governments and within the legal system to try to achieve fairer outcomes for the most disadvantaged and marginalized women and children.
  • Justice for David Dungay, Jr., a fund in memory of David Dungay, Jr., a young, Aboriginal man who recently died in police custody.

 

Follow Wonder Media Network:

  • Website
  • Instagram
  • Twitter

Follow host Jerico Mandybur:

  • Instagram
  • Twitter

Go to madison-reed.com/beyondbelief  for your color kit today!
Go to sakara.com/beyondbelief for delicious meals, daily essentials, and more!

itunes.author: Wonder Media Network LLC
itunes.keywords: sagittarius, aliza kelly, meme, aquarius, pisces, jerico mandybur, horoscopes, cancer, scorpio, gemini, moon sign, beyond belief, virgo, leo, capricorn, sun sign, taurus, astrology, rising sign, libra, aries, astrologer
itunes.subtitle: In the last few years, astrology has exploded into the mainstream once again, and both its subscribers and its critics are in hot debate. But as astrologers themselves know, the practice of astrology is much richer and more complicated than any magazine spread or meme can explain. Here, host Jerico Mandybur, meets acclaimed astrologer, Aliza Kelly, to find out just how deep the rabbit hole goes.
itunes.summary: In the last few years, astrology has exploded into the mainstream once again, and both its subscribers and its critics are in hot debate. But as astrologers themselves know, the practice of astrology is much richer and more complicated than any magazine spread or meme can explain. Here, host Jerico Mandybur, meets acclaimed astrologer, Aliza Kelly, to find out just how deep the rabbit hole goes.

items.title: Mapping the Soul

itunes.keywords: aja daashuur, spirits, ghosts, medium, jerico mandybur, beyond belief, wonder media network, the spirit guide coach, new age, spirit guide
itunes.subtitle: Belief in spirit guides used to be reserved for the staunchly new age crowd, but these days, you’re just as likely to overhear millennials talking about them over matcha. So what are they? And how do they…work? On this episode, Jerico Mandybur speaks to a popular spirit guide communicator and medium, Aja Daashuur aka The Spirit Guide Coach to learn more.

itunes.author: Wonder Media Network LLC
itunes.subtitle: Magick practiced by witches, Wiccans, and wizards typically abides by a set of rules. So what happens when you throw out the rule book and do things the DIY way? According to this week’s guest, occult historian, author, and advocate of what he calls anarchic magick, Mitch Horowitz, you open up a world of possibilities where magic can be anything you want it to be. No cauldron necessary.
itunes.summary: Magick practiced by witches, Wiccans, and wizards typically abides by a set of rules. So what happens when you throw out the rule book and do things the DIY way? According to this week’s guest, occult historian, author, and advocate of what he calls anarchic magick, Mitch Horowitz, you open up a world of possibilities where magic can be anything you want it to be. No cauldron necessary.

items.title: The Anarchy of Magick

itunes.author: Edie Allard, Liz Smith, Jerico Mandybur
itunes.keywords: belief systems, the secret, jerico mandybur, manifestation, law of attraction, aaron rose, power of the mind, beyond belief
itunes.subtitle: The Law of Attraction is the theory underpinning most people’s understanding of manifestation; what you think, you attract. It’s an attractive concept, but not without it’s vocal critics who say it doesn’t account for inequalities and injustices. Our host Jerico Mandybur speaks to Law of Attraction expert and coach, Aaron Rose, to find out how (if at all) one can reconcile this belief with the realities of the world we live in.
itunes.summary: The Law of Attraction is the theory underpinning most people’s understanding of manifestation; what you think, you attract. It’s an attractive concept, but not without it’s vocal critics who say it doesn’t account for inequalities and injustices. Our host Jerico Mandybur speaks to Law of Attraction expert and coach, Aaron Rose, to find out how (if at all) one can reconcile this belief with the realities of the world we live in.

items.title: The Law of Attraction & Privilege

itunes.author: Wonder Media Network LLC
itunes.subtitle: Stigmata isn’t just a horror movie. It’s the widespread phenomenon, still happening today, where Christians display the physical wounds of a crucified Jesus; bleeding from the hands and feet. Is it an elaborate con? A miracle? Host Jerico Mandybur speaks to an expert on the phenomenon, author and religious experiences expert, Ted Harrison.
itunes.summary: Stigmata isn’t just a horror movie. It’s the widespread phenomenon, still happening today, where Christians display the physical wounds of a crucified Jesus; bleeding from the hands and feet. Is it an elaborate con? A miracle? Host Jerico Mandybur speaks to an expert on the phenomenon, author and religious experiences expert, Ted Harrison.

items.title: The Bleeding Mind

itunes.author: Wonder Media Network LLC
itunes.subtitle: There's an oddly strong link between dolphins and new age spirituality. For some believers, dolphins hold an elevated form of consciousness that lets them telepathically communicate with some people, passing on messages for humanity’s survival. One of these people is guest Frances Fox, who has been communicating with dolphins for years.  Host Jerico Mandybur chats with Frances about the ins and outs of this unique line of communication.
itunes.summary: There's an oddly strong link between dolphins and new age spirituality. For some believers, dolphins hold an elevated form of consciousness that lets them telepathically communicate with some people, passing on messages for humanity’s survival. One of these people is guest Frances Fox, who has been communicating with dolphins for years.  Host Jerico Mandybur chats with Frances about the ins and outs of this unique line of communication.

items.title: Dolphins Cry

itunes.author: Wonder Media Network LLC
itunes.subtitle: The Conjure Woman has always been racialized and vilified; depicted as a trickster, devious and transgressive. But the reality of conjure—and all the Black folk magic practitioners under its umbrella, including root workers, hoodoo doctors, and priestesses—is a far cry from that. Our host Jerico Mandybur speaks with Dr. Kinitra Brooks, a scholar of conjure and its representations, to sort fact from fiction.
itunes.summary: The Conjure Woman has always been racialized and vilified; depicted as a trickster, devious and transgressive. But the reality of conjure—and all the Black folk magic practitioners under its umbrella, including root workers, hoodoo doctors, and priestesses—is a far cry from that. Our host Jerico Mandybur speaks with Dr. Kinitra Brooks, a scholar of conjure and its representations, to sort fact from fiction.

items.title: The Conjure is Political

itunes.keywords: reading, poltergeist, birth chart, spirits, ghosts, medium, jerico mandybur, ghost whisperer, seance, jessica lanyadoo, beyond belief, ghost of a podcast, ghost, astrology, astrologer, psychic, dead people
itunes.subtitle: Psychic mediums are often viewed as charlatans, preying on the recently bereaved. But for others, they represent closure, comfort, and hope. But what do these ghost whisperers themselves believe is going on here? Our host Jerico Mandybur speaks with astrologer and psychic medium, Jessica Lanyadoo, to find out what it’s *actually* like to talk to dead people.
itunes.summary: Psychic mediums are often viewed as charlatans, preying on the recently bereaved. But for others, they represent closure, comfort, and hope. But what do these ghost whisperers themselves believe is going on here? Our host Jerico Mandybur speaks with astrologer and psychic medium, Jessica Lanyadoo, to find out what it’s *actually* like to talk to dead people.

items.title: I See Dead People

itunes.keywords: satanism, satanic panic, activism, religion, sexism, jerico mandybur, lucifer, evil, feminism, satanic, satan, beyond belief, politics, devil, jex blackmore
itunes.subtitle: How far have we come from the “Satanic panic”-marked 80s and 90s? On this episode of Beyond Belief, we explore the other side of Satanism. The side occupied by feminists and thinkers of all religious persuasions—and none. Our host Jerico Mandybur speaks to Jex Blackmore, a feminist activist, artist, and prominent Satanist to hear about her take on the Devil.
itunes.summary: How far have we come from the “Satanic panic”-marked 80s and 90s? On this episode of Beyond Belief, we explore the other side of Satanism. The side occupied by feminists and thinkers of all religious persuasions—and none. Our host Jerico Mandybur speaks to Jex Blackmore, a feminist activist, artist, and prominent Satanist to hear about her take on the Devil.

itunes.author: Wonder Media Network, Jerico Mandybur
itunes.subtitle: We all want to believe in something, especially during uncertain times. Beyond Belief is a new podcast from Wonder Media Network hosted by Jerico Mandybur, best-selling author and spiritual coach, that explores non-traditional belief systems. Meant for skeptics and believers alike, we explore the far out, the unreal, and everything in between.
itunes.summary: We all want to believe in something, especially during uncertain times. Beyond Belief is a new podcast from Wonder Media Network hosted by Jerico Mandybur, best-selling author and spiritual coach, that explores non-traditional belief systems. Meant for skeptics and believers alike, we explore the far out, the unreal, and everything in between.

title: Beyond Belief
